snippet: A second day of shelling across the Turkish-Syrian border threatened to catapult the Syria crisis into a wider regional war. But will that threat push international leaders to find a solution to the underlying conflict?
abstract: A second day of shelling across the Turkish-Syrian border threatened to catapult the Syria crisis into a wider regional war. But will that threat push international leaders to find a solution to the underlying conflict?

headline.main: Options Limited as Syria Conflict Spreads

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
